openstack.cloud.deployer.title: SUSE Openstack Cloud Deployer
install.intro.message.body1: You are about to install a new cloud.
install.intro.message.body2: You will need to supply information about the servers, networks and storage that will make up your cloud. The Openstack Cloud installer will then take care of deploying and configuring your new cloud for you.
install.intro.message.steps.heading: The steps you will complete to install your cloud are:

model.summary.role.description.CONTROLLE: Controllers are an essential component of an OpenStack Cloud. We will deploy services such as Keystone, Horizon, Glance here.
model.summary.role.description.COMPUTE-R: Compute nodes is where your workload will eventually run. We will host services such as Nova on those machines. Make sure those machines have enough capacity.
model.summary.role.description.MTRMON-RO: SUSE OpenStack Cloud is an enterprise class solution, this is why we ship monitoring capabilities with our system to allow for Day 2 operations out of the box.
model.summary.role.description.SWOBJ-ROL: You can optionally add storage nodes to your deployment, and configure access to those nodes right from this panel.
model.summary.role.description.NOT_FOUND: Describe the fact that the customer must have created this role
